Table of Contents

Namespace osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers

Classes

AudioContainer

A container which exposes audio adjustments via IAggregateAudioAdjustment.

AudioContainer<T>

A container which exposes audio adjustments via IAggregateAudioAdjustment.

BasicScrollContainer
BasicScrollContainer<T>
BasicScrollContainer<T>.BasicScrollbar
BufferedContainer

A container that renders its children to an internal framebuffer, and then blits the framebuffer to the screen, instead of directly rendering the children to the screen. This allows otherwise impossible effects to be applied to the appearance of the container at the cost of performance. Such effects include uniform fading of children, blur, and other post-processing effects. If all children are of a specific non-Drawable type, use the generic version BufferedContainer<T>.

BufferedContainer<T>

A container that renders its children to an internal framebuffer, and then blits the framebuffer to the screen, instead of directly rendering the children to the screen. This allows otherwise impossible effects to be applied to the appearance of the container at the cost of performance. Such effects include uniform fading of children, blur, and other post-processing effects.

CircularContainer

A container which is rounded (via automatic corner-radius and corner-exponent=2) on the shortest edge.

ClickableContainer
CompositeComponent

An updateable component that can be inserted into the draw hierarchy and has self-managed child components. This is currently used as a marker for cases where nothing more than load, update, lifetime support and hierarchy presence are required. Eventually this will be fleshed out (and the inheritance will be reversed to Drawable : Component).

CompositeDrawable

A drawable consisting of a composite of child drawables which are managed by the composite object itself. Transformations applied to a CompositeDrawable are also applied to its children. Additionally, CompositeDrawables support various effects, such as masking, edge effect, padding, and automatic sizing depending on their children.

CompositeDrawable.ChildComparer
CompositeDrawable.CompositeDrawableDrawNode

A draw node responsible for rendering a CompositeDrawable and the DrawNodes of its children.

Container

A drawable which can have children added to it. Transformations applied to a container are also applied to its children. Additionally, containers support various effects, such as masking, edge effect, padding, and automatic sizing depending on their children. If all children are of a specific non-Drawable type, use the generic version Container<T>.

ContainerExtensions

Holds extension methods for Container<T>.

Container<T>

A drawable which can have children added to it. Transformations applied to a container are also applied to its children. Additionally, containers support various effects, such as masking, edge effect, padding, and automatic sizing depending on their children.

CustomizableTextContainer

A TextFlowContainer that supports adding icons into its text. Inherit from this class to define reusable custom placeholders for icons.

DelayedLoadUnloadWrapper
DelayedLoadWrapper

A container which asynchronously loads specified content. Has the ability to delay the loading until it has been visible on-screen for a specified duration. In order to benefit from delayed load, we must be inside a ScrollContainer<T>.

Dimension

Defines the size of a row or column in a GridContainer.

DrawSizePreservingFillContainer

A Container filling its parent while preserving a given target DrawSize according to a DrawSizePreservationStrategy. This is useful, for example, to automatically scale the user interface according to the window resolution, or to provide automatic HiDPI display support.

FillFlowContainer

A FlowContainer<T> that fills space by arranging its children next to each other. Children can be arranged horizontally, vertically, and in a combined fashion, which is controlled by Direction. Children are arranged from left-to-right if their Anchor is to the left or centered horizontally. They are arranged from right-to-left otherwise. Children are arranged from top-to-bottom if their Anchor is to the top or centered vertically. They are arranged from bottom-to-top otherwise. If non-DrawableChildren are desired, use FillFlowContainer<T>.

FillFlowContainer<T>

A FlowContainer<T> that fills space by arranging its children next to each other. Children can be arranged horizontally, vertically, and in a combined fashion, which is controlled by Direction. Children are arranged from left-to-right if their Anchor is to the left or centered horizontally. They are arranged from right-to-left otherwise. Children are arranged from top-to-bottom if their Anchor is to the top or centered vertically. They are arranged from bottom-to-top otherwise.

FlowContainer<T>

A container that can be used to fluently arrange its children.

FocusedOverlayContainer

An overlay container that eagerly holds keyboard focus.

GridContainer

A container which allows laying out Drawables in a grid.

GridContainerContent

A wrapper for the content of a GridContainer that provides notifications when elements are changed.

LifetimeManagementContainer

This container is optimized for when number of alive children is significantly smaller than number of all children. Specifically, the time complexity of Update() should be closer to O(number of alive children + 1) rather than O(number of all children + 1) for typical frames.

ModelBackedDrawable<T>

Manages dynamically displaying a custom Drawable based on a model object. Useful for replacing Drawables on the fly.

OverlayContainer

An element which starts hidden and can be toggled to visible.

RearrangeableListContainer<TModel>

A list container that enables its children to be rearranged via dragging.

RearrangeableListItem<TModel>

An item of a RearrangeableListContainer<TModel>.

SafeAreaContainer

An Container that can also apply a padding based on the safe areas of the nearest cached SafeAreaDefiningContainer. Padding will only be applied if the contents of this container would otherwise intersect the safe area margins relative to the associated target container.

SafeAreaDefiningContainer

A Container that is automatically cached and provides a BindableSafeArea representing the desired safe area margins. Should be used in conjunction with child SafeAreaContainers. The root of the scenegraph contains an instance of this container, with BindableSafeArea automatically bound to the host IWindow's SafeAreaPadding.

ScrollContainer<T>
ScrollContainer<T>.ScrollbarContainer
SearchContainer
SearchContainer<T>

A container which automatically filters IFilterable children based on a search term. Re-filtering will only be performed when the SearchTerm changes, or the layout of the container is invalidated.

TabbableContainer
TabbableContainer<T>
TableColumn

Defines a column of the TableContainer.

TableContainer

A container which tabulates Drawables.

TextChunk<TSpriteText>

Represents a plain chunk of text to be displayed in a text flow.

TextFlowContainer

A drawable text object that supports more advanced text formatting.

TextFlowContainer.NewLineContainer
TextNewLine
TextPart

A basic implementation of ITextPart, which automatically handles returning correct Drawables and raising DrawablePartsRecreated.

TextPartManual

An ITextPart which utilises externally-provided drawables. Will never recreate its contents or raise DrawablePartsRecreated.

VirtualisedListContainer<TData, TDrawable>

This class is an alternative to combined ScrollContainer<T> / FlowContainer<T> usage for large lists (think thousands of items). This class efficiently handles collection change events, as well as applies pooling to only allocate drawables for what is actually visible on screen. The trade-off is that every row has to have an estimated or fixed height so that layout can be estimated cheaply pre-emptively.

VirtualisedListContainer<TData, TDrawable>.ItemFlow
VirtualisedListContainer<TData, TDrawable>.ItemRow
VisibilityContainer

A container which adds a basic visibility state.

Structs

Container<T>.Enumerator
LifetimeBoundaryCrossedEvent

Represents that the clock is crossed LifetimeManagementContainer's child lifetime boundary i.e. LifetimeStart or LifetimeEnd,

Interfaces

IBufferedContainer
IConditionalFilterable

Am IFilterable that additionally allows specifying whether the item can be shown based on additional criteria. The item will be visible in a SearchContainer if and only if FilterTerms match and CanBeShown is true.

IContainer
IContainerCollection<T>
IContainerEnumerable<T>
IFillFlowContainer
IFilterable

Implementing this interface in a Drawable allows it to be filtered basing on provided search terms when placed inside a SearchContainer<T>.

IHasFilterTerms

An interface to expose a number of keywords with the intent of helping a parent filter results. See IFilterable for an interface which adds a callback on matching keywords.

IHasFilterableChildren
ISafeArea

Containers that implement this interface act as a target for any child SafeAreaContainers.

IScrollContainer
ITabbableContainer

This interface is used for recognizing TabbableContainer<T> of any type without reflection.

ITextPart

Represents a part of text inside a TextFlowContainer. This implementation allows for the contents of a text part to be swapped out, in order to support things like text localisation, for instance.

Enums

DrawSizePreservationStrategy

Strategies used by DrawSizePreservingFillContainer to enforce its TargetDrawSize.

EffectPlacement
FillDirection

Represents the direction children of a FillFlowContainer<T> should be filled in.

GridSizeMode
Visibility
